note.p: Birth: Leicester House, London, England (15 April 1721)
Death: Upper Grosvenor Street, London (31 October 1765)
Burial: West end of Henry VII's chapel, Westminster
Career: Field Marshal and Commander in Chief of the Army; commanded the Army at Fontenoy (1745) and at Culloden Moor (1746)
References: Desmond King-Hele, 'Man of Many Mysteries', review of Joy Hancox, The Queen's Chameleon: the Life of John Byrom in NR 1996 vol 50 pp 256-258, plate
